website_summaries.verdict: If you want power, variety, and value, this set earns high marks for including numerous extras and 2 drills that are capable of tackling most tasks.
pros: A comprehensive kit for an excellent price, as you get an impact driver and drill driver, rechargeable cordless flashlight, 2 lithium batteries, and a charger
cons: Some kits had at least one "dud" battery that quits working after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: SUPER Happy!!
customer_reviews.text: This drill set is Awesome!! The Superintendent at the construction company I work for was pretty impressed by the power of the impact.. I know they make "better" "newer" one's but I've wanted the matching White/black combo for years and these are EVERYTHING I've wanted!! Lol The only negative I had ( hence the 4*) is it comes with the 1.5 ah batteries, If it came with the 2.0 ah batteries I woulda gave a 5 but still SUPER Happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: It's a Win / Win
customer_reviews.text: I actually owned the cordless driver package and found its small size to be extremely beneficial. Used it long enough for it to outlast the batteries.So, when it came time to replace the batteries I opted to get this complete package instead. I use the impact tool a great deal more than I once did, the batteries are interchangeable across all three tools so it's a win / win for me.
customer_reviews.author: SnowmanXT

customer_reviews.title: Not up to standards
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a huge fan of Makita tools and these cordless drill are priced great, feel light and sturdy. My only dissatisfaction is when your drill through thick would like treated pine the drill gets hot and shuts off after only a minute of use and you have to wait for it to cool down before you can use them again. If I knew what this would happen I would have never purchased these drills.
customer_reviews.author: James Rapp

customer_reviews.title: Makita makes great tools
customer_reviews.text: Makita makes excellent cordless tools, and I picked up this set in December when the price was low. Great set, and they have improved the carrying bag too, it's much more practical now over the old cube-shaped design. If you are just starting your cordless tool collection, this set is a great start. I recommend you buy a decent set of bits that work with the impact driver, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Spade

customer_reviews.title: Makita is the best
customer_reviews.text: I am a granite fabricator and makita is always our tool brand of choice when it comes to angle grinders. I decided to get the drill because I've already went thru 3 ryobis in 2 years and they do not disappoint! Light, agile, powerful. Get them you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Volkan

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought a similar set about 15 years ago and thought just in case, buy another set. They are small and comfortable to the hand but very powerful. I just found out this model has been discontinued so I feel happy I was able to purchase them. Mikita makes a great tool, I have about seven of there tools.
customer_reviews.author: B & J

customer_reviews.title: Great set won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The drill and impact work great have used them continually with hanging dry wall to drilling holes to run wires through 2x4s. Haven't had any problems. Ran the impact multiple times for more then 12 hrs straight never over heated and the battery held up good. The only down side would be the light it is just an average light not very bright but will do in a emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight construction of tool which helps for long day use.
customer_reviews.text: Does not seem to be built as solid as my original tools purchased 13 years ago. My original impact driver still works. I guess time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best drills ive owned
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift. Best drills ive ever owned. The quality is incredible. Battery life is excellent. I cant find anything bad to say. Makita is the brand my pop used forever, and i have no doubt these will last the same.
customer_reviews.author: Gene K

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with a screwdriver bit so had to get one before use (my Ryobi brand came with a reversible bit that was store on it). Carrying bag nice, easy to charge, and worked well for putting up a big mailbox using girl power!!!!! Has two batteries to keep one charges always
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Mary C.

customer_reviews.title: 1900 RPM
customer_reviews.text: I use it at work we drill aluminum, steel, and stainless. it has a chuck that holds the drill bits tight.

customer_reviews.title: SO GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: We got these as a wedding gift and used them to finish our entire basement by ourselves. Absolutely amazing. The batteries last a long time, they charge quick, and they're easy to use. Yeah, their a little pricey, but you'll definitely get your moneys worth out of them.

customer_reviews.text: As usual, a pleasure to use. Considerably lighter than my older model. Battery lasts ~ as long as the old NiMH but is much smaller and lighter. They have fantastic torque.

customer_reviews.title: There may be better (Festool? ) but between ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: We're woodworkers in Brooklyn, we've been using Makitas for many years. We're committed to the guns/batteries/chargers. There may be better (Festool?) but between ergonomics, price & performance these are the best choice for us. If I'd read more carefully, I wouldn't have ordered w/ 1.5am, but not worth returning. Perhaps they'll serve as lighter followup kit (I tried little 12v some years ago, for this purpose, seduced because they were cute, but batteries were dreadful). Slightly larger concern is that drill, not impact gun, doesn't seem to fit other batteries. Again not a big issue but compatibility is important when you're on a ladder with 20 minutes to go on a Friday afternoon....;)
customer_reviews.author: jozef koppelman

customer_reviews.title: ... son who does custom cabinetry & guess what~ he LOVED it!

customer_reviews.title: Not NEW, open box item--very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed to be sent an open box item and even more disappointed that it arrived with both batteries attached to the drill/driver and with no internal cushioning/packaging. The drill and driver were loose and banging around inside the box when it arrived. I don't mind an open box deal but this was presented as a NEW item and it was the same price as what Home Depot was offering on this kit on Black Friday. Otherwise the actual drill and driver combo look and feel great and would have been perfect for what I need. Too bad it's going back to Amazon.

When it came the impact driver was impacted on the plastic around the trigger and was not operational and looked destroyed despite the box being in damaged! But amazon did great with the return and the second time around it came without any defects. Am very pleased with the items, and look forward to using them more.

product_meta.title: Makita CT322W 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Compact Cordless 3-Pc. Combo Kit
product_meta.description: The Makita 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Compact 3-Piece Combo Kit (CT322R) is built for the pro user who demands best-in-class Lithium-Ion cordless tools for drilling, driving, and fastening in a compact size. The kit includes a 1/2" driver-drill and an impact driver, as well as an L.E.D. Flashlight, Rapid Optimum Charger, and two fast-charging 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Compact batteries for use with Makita's range of 18V cordless tools. The CT322R includes a 1/2” driver-drill with 480 in. lbs. of torque that weighs only 3.3 lbs., and a versatile impact driver with 1,460 . of torque that weighs only 2.8 lbs. (both weights with 1.5Ah battery), and a flashlight with 6 L.E.D. bulbs that deliver 500 lumens brightness for portable illumination. It’s part of Makita’s expanding 18V Lithium-Ion system, the world’s largest cordless tool system powered by 18V Lithium-Ion slide-style batteries. Makita 18V Lithium-Ion batteries have the fastest charge times in their categories, so they spend more time working and less time sitting on the charger. For improved tool performance and extended battery life, Makita created Star Protection Computer Controls . Star Protection is communication technology that allows the Star Protection-equipped tool and battery to exchange data in real time and monitor conditions during use to protect against overloading, over-discharging and overheating. For increased versatility, the tool can also be powered by Makita 18V LXT and Compact Lithium-Ion batteries with the star symbol on the battery indicating Star Protection inside.
feature_bullets: 1/2" Driver-Drill with 2-speeds (0-600 & 0-1, 900 RPM) delivers up to 480 in. Lbs. Of max torque
1/2" Driver-Drill features a compact design at only 7-1/4" long and weighs only 3.3 lbs. With battery for reduced operator fatigue
Impact driver with variable speed (0-2, 900 RPM & 0-3, 500 IPM) delivers up to 1, 460. Of max torque. 4-position head pivots for versatility
Impact driver features a compact design at only 5-3/8" long and weighs only 2.8 lbs. With battery for reduced operator fatigue
Ergonomically designed handles with rubberized soft grips provide increased comfort

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars261 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
